Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, but noisy I stayed at this hotel with my teenage daughter. It is very conveniently sited on the main street running from the train station to the city centre. The hotel was spotless, the staff friendly and helpful and the room larger than average. The beds were very comfortable.The only downside was that we had a room facing the main road, and there was a lot of noise (penalty of being in such a convenient location). The room had double glazing, but the noise still travelled (thin walls?)My advice would be ask for a room at the back of the hotel, or take earplugs!
Reviews.Author: NottinghamJules

Reviews.Content: Best Customer Service OK, so I did my research for a two day stopover in Frankfurt and decided that the Hotel Kaiserhof on Kaiserstrasse near the Hauptbanhoff was the place for me. I found a great rate online and booked it. Done.I easily found the hotel in its incredibly convenient location a block from the train station. I had my printed confirmation and passport at the ready. Ms. James at the front desk spoke English better than I did (in addition to her native Italian and adopted German and I'm sure a few others as well), greeted me warmly, and asked for my information. She couldn't find me in the computer and asked my confirmation. Uh oh. It turns out that there is *another* Hotel Kaiserhof on *another* Kaiserstrasse near *another* Hauptbanhoff in a suburb of Frankfurt and I had accidentally booked that one. Rather than point out that this was entirely my fault, Ms. James gave me a password to use the computer upstairs to try to cancel that reservation. When it was too late to cancel online she let me use her personal cell phone to try to to cancel the other hotel without penalty (knowing that if I called using her hotel's line they surely wouldn't). Then the manager came in and called the other hotel to cancel for me , gave me a great rate and breakfast coupons, and just generally made me feel taken care of. At no point in the process did anyone point out that this was my own damn fault and they were both so incredibly nice that I knew I'd made the right decision.The room was surprisingly large for Europe, had both a bath tub and shower curtain (also a pleasant surprise), and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was contintental plus a few hot dishes; the yogurt was particularly good. The hotel is a block from the main train station so gettting to and from the airport is a cinch, and it was walking distance to the Romerburg (old city) and Museumsufer, though if walking is not your thing you can easily catch public transport. I found the different ethnicities represented in the neighborhood lively and interesting, and the red light element was tame to non-existent. I was traveling on my own (petite woman) and felt no compunction about walking around by myself day or night.I recommend this hotel without reservation.
Reviews.Author: nicegirl512

Reviews.Content: Average       The room
Reviews.Author: leannenufc

Reviews.Content: Average budget hotel I stayed in this hotel for two nights. The experience was decent. The rooms were clean but lacked facilities. For example, there was no kettle, cutlery, complimentary tea/coffee, minibar etc. There was hair dryer and soap but no other bathroom amenities. We requested a kettle and were given one by reception (but I get the sense that there isnt one for every room) and requested two forks but there was only one left. The staff were however quite nice and helpful. Checkout time was 11:30 but if you go past 12 there is a charge of 45 euros. The double bed was two single beds pushed together.The location was excellent, a two minute walk from the central railway station. It is right in the middle of a prominent red light district but it didn't feel unsafe.If you want to store your luggage, there is a closet on the ground floor at reception but it is not locked.Overall it was a decent budget hotel for the price paid.
Reviews.Author: water_lili_88

Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay We read several reviews on this property and felt it would meet our needs which it certainly did. It was close to the Main Rail Station,two blocks, served a buffet breakfast at a reasonable rate and the rooms were spotless. The entire property had been upgraded recently and the baths in particular were beautiful. The desk staff was helpfull and spoke English. The neighborhood is a little run down but we found Alexander's returant a block away on Kaiserstr, which served a very good dinner at a reasonable cost. It was really a cozy spt on a cold winter night. Booking was easy as it a Quality hotel and has 800 # from anywgere in the U.S. We will return on our next trip to Germany.
Reviews.Author: ua1953

Reviews.Content: Try somewhere else first I stayed here in early January, 2008 and had a very poor quality stay. The low rates, close proximity to the Hauptbahnhof, and cordial front desk staff were fine, but the absence of soundproofing around the hotel room door made for a sleepless night.Normal hallway sounds (i,e, voices, moving luggage) were amplified in my 6th floor room, and I was awakened each time a guest/family departed. In my experience, this was at 4am, 5am, 5:30am, and 6am. As a result, I fail to see the quality in the Quality Inn, and I recommend staying at another hotel, if available.
Reviews.Author: DrRingDing

Reviews.Content: Perfect except for wifi I have had some bad experiences at hotels, but this was a great one. The reviews from this site are usually terrifying, so the mere existence of a good one made me stay at this hotel.The room was clean, the staff was very nice. Breakfast was included and was pretty good. I paid for 12 hours of non-continuous wifi and it was down from 7am-2pm, which was a bunch of the time I wanted to use it. That was the only part I wasn't crazy about.It's in the redlight district, but there was a street fair selling all kinds of wonderful food while i stayed. I thought the sex shops were funny rather than bad. It's VERY close to the main train station and a quick walk to almost everything else in the city.Highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: joipodgorny

Reviews.Content: maybe it suits, maybe not So everything has been said about this hotel and most of it is true, at least I had similar experiences:- the staff is REALLY strange, maybe because they only pay minimum wages and don't get real staff- the rooms are quite, clean, and spacy enough- the hotel is in the red light district but close to main station and everythingSo here is my advice to you.Book this hotel:if money counts because the rates are good.if you don't stay for a long time.if you are a business traveller and do not plan to spend too much time in the room anyway.Under no circumstances book this hotel:if you plan a romantic getaway with your loved oneif you plan a family trip with children or older peopleif you stay for a longer time because for sure you will get depressed
Reviews.Author: joeycoco

Reviews.Content: Convenient to train station This is actually now part of the Quality Hotel chain. As previous posters have mentioned, it is right next to the red light district, but I never felt unsafe. It's only two blocks from the train station and that's the main reason I picked this hotel. We had an early flight, and it was a lot more reasonable price to stay here and take the short S-Bahn train to the airport in the morning than staying at an airport hotel.The lady that checked us in was friendly and spoke English clearly, but the gentleman that checked us out seemed annoyed to be dealing with a check-out. Though it was 4:45 in the morning, so I don't know too many people that would be overly excited at that time of day anyway.The room was clean, good sized. Only a view of the nearby rooftops, but it is a large city, so wasn't expecting much. At least that way it was quiet. It was also walking distance to the city center and lots of restaurant options.I'd definitely stay here again if I need a place to stay in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: WIatHeart

Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel I have stayed at the Kaiserhof several times and have never had a bad experience there. The young lady that works at the front desk is very friendly and helpful. She is a gem and I would recommend the hotel based on dealing with her. One of her male co-workers was a bit grumpy but he worked the night shift and, quite honestly, we likely tested his patience with our bending of the rules.The women that work in the breakfast room were also very nice. We were always greeted with a smile and they tried to speak English to us, which we really appreciated. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The rooms facing Kaiserstrasse provide a bit of entertainment but can be really hot. We stayed in bigger rooms at the back in May and they were very nice with air conditioning, but alas nothing to look at out the window.Another great thing about this hotel is the price. The rooms are so reasonably priced and with breakfast included it is an even better deal. It is easy to get to the main train station and to the tourist and shopping areas. There are lots of restaurants, bakeries and bars nearby. Reasonably priced, clean, convenient, friendly staff and a good breakfast- what more could you ask for?
Reviews.Author: bettelyons

Reviews.Content: Honest Review 2 travellers - one male aged 27 and one female aged 28. We were in Frankfurt for 2 weeks. Location - The Hotel is located in a semi-red light district with sex shops however do not let this deter you. The people do not harass you in anyway, they are typical cruisers. It is well patroled by police at night and there is no sense of danger at all. Ironically, it is quite welcoming. It is very near the city centre (in fact its on the same stree - 10 min walk). Hotel Room - The room is an adequate size. The bathroom is clean and everything works. The room is cleaned every morning and the supervisor regularly visits to ensure approproate standards. The pillows are huge though. Noise does filter through though looking outside is interesting - good place to people watch. There is always something happening - never a dull moment. If windows are closed, you can rest peacefully. Food - The breakfast is wide ranging from eggs, cereal to salmon. The catering staff are very nice and do try to communicate in English if German is not your first language. Staff - The staff on the front desk are also very welcoming though the male staff are somewhat strange. They stare at you for ages without speaking - kind of awkward. They are avilable 24/7. If you have any queries about the hotel or Frankfurt, email me on neo_modernstudies@hotmail.co.uk
Reviews.Author: TheScottishOracle

Reviews.Content: Great base for travellers with good standards but not the bank balance to match! A stone's throw away from Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof, this hotel is an ideal location for a first night's stay in the area or even as a base for the entire duration. We needed a convenient hotel before a music tour of the Hesse region that was reasonable, centrally located, clean and friendly; it didn't disappoint. The staff were really helpful, particularly the female receptionist with long dark hair and the rooms were exactly what we needed. It may not have been luxurious but we didn't need that nor was it in our budget! As other reviewers have said, the hotel is close to quite a few adult bookshops, cinemas and clubs but this is Germany and even at night it is by no means threatening and we walked around feeling just as secure as if it had been the middle of the day. A couple of days a week Kaiserstrasse is filled with stalls selling fresh produce and German-style fast food; which seemed very popular with the be-suited German workforce and the samples we tried were great. Overall, we were extremely happy with our experience at this hotel, so much so that we booked a further night at the end of our tour along with two other people in our party for our last night.
Reviews.Author: RagnoRosso

Reviews.Content: Great City everything is within easy reach My cousin and I both went to Frankfurt for 2 weeks and loved it. We went to experience the culture, the people, the food and the lifestyle of Europeans and that is exactly what we got.The city offers many different places to visit, to dine, to relax and perhaps some areas to avoid if your not as open minded as others but hey your in Germany, it is after all one of the most cultured cities of the world!! The city is full of people from different backgrounds which is what I loved because I came across people, places and foods which were of course German as well as Italian, Turkish, Greek, Spanish, Asian and British which really opens your mind to diverse cultures.Frankfurt is the financial capital of Germany so you had your sky scrapers and massive banks, buildings and monuments but amongst the city were little towns and areas which seemed completely away from the city. For example the city centre is heaving 24/7, then there is the old town which is across the bridge which is like another city, you have the West end which is similiar to some streets of London and there is so much more to see. Trust me the best thing to do is see the tourist spots first and then explore the city your way because you discover so much more than what is on the brochure. I spent 8 hours on foot immersing myself in the city and West end area and funnily enough felt like a native more than a tourist but if that isn't your thing then the tour bus and ferry ride is always available.Public transport is quick and fairly cheap so you won't have much trouble travelling around but we both opted for travelling on foot as the weather was beautiful and we were never far away from an attraction or great places to eat. The food is amazing as I lost a few pounds from the purse but gained a few in the weight department as their is such a variety of foods for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. I would recommend Thai food especially in a little Thai place called 'Thai Fun' which is 5-8 minutes walk from the train station, the food is 10 out of 10 and with such large portions at great prices I would recommed it to everyone.The bakeries are great too and cheap if you want something cold to eat and there are many great fast food places to eat all over the city.The Hotel 'Kaiserhoff' was great and I have no complaints as we only needed to sleep there. The staff were great and we appreciated the fact that they at least spoke English as in some countries English isn't an option, so the bi-lingual staff were fantastic and very friendly.The breakfast was great and there was a variety of foods available and no one went hungary in the breakfast room trust me I watched how people shovelled food in the plate. The room was clean, room service was good and yes at night there was sometimes noise coming from outside but the hotel is in the city centre surrounded by city buildings, pubs, restaurents, shops etc so in fairness a little noise is to be expected. The area was safe as no one bothers you unless you bother them and the red light district is amusing as it is the 'norm' there and Ann Summers is probably saucier! However I wouldn't bring young children to the city as there aren't many things for them to do and the parks are usually deserted. But for those people wanting to experience a open minded, cultured and tolerent European city then I would definitely recommend Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: LoneSoul

Reviews.Content: Good Value For Money Hotel Kaisarhof, FrankfurtApril 27th 2007, 4 NightsI was on a business Trip and didnt want to stay in an expensive Hotel.I booked this hotel expecting the worst.At Euro 67/Night,I was expecting much.To my utter surprise, the hotel was nice,Room was very good size,a few English Channels like CNN/BBC/Euro Sports.Location also was super, within walking distance of the Main Station.Clean n comfortable bathroom.Good experience!JP Hazarat, Mumbai, India
Reviews.Author: CCLASS

Reviews.Content: Surprisingly Good Arrived here for a business trip in the dark as a solo female traveller. Fortunately I had checked out TA reviews first so wasn't completely shocked at the area but was still a little surprised that there was so much openly on display in the windows of the s*x shops! The staff all spoke really good English. The rooms were nice and clean and of a good size. There was no real restuarant or bar but the reception served drinks at a reasonable price and there was a breakfast room serving a full continental breakfast which was actually fairly good and included hot options too.Despite the surrouding area being very interesting I nev er felt unsafe and quite happily went out for a night time wander with some other female colleagues I met up with. There are some quite nice restaurants all within easy walking distance. It is also only a very short walk to the nearest train station and costs about 23 Euros for a taxi here from Fankfurt airport.All in all a very comfortable stay and incredible value for money!!
Reviews.Author: shelly67

Reviews.Content: Decent place Great location near train station, made it easy to get to and from airport and to city center. Very LARGE rooms by europen standards, they were average/decent and a good value. I stayed here with my 15 your old son on two different nights in two different rooms. The neighborhood was intersting and fine. I suspect those who don't like the location are American tourists not used to openess in Europe. Probaly the same people who were shocked by Janet Jacksons boob shot. But unlike other Americans, I prefer sex to violence... but I guess thats another forum... We never ate at the hotel, prefering to explore the city during our layover. Lots of good restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk.Every member of the staff spoke English and was very helpful. Even the night auditor was helpful and they are suually the worst. This hotel has been rebranded a QUAILITY INN but is of much better quility than the USA hotels. The only problem we had was lousy internet reception in the rooms. Had to bring the laptop near the door for good quality reception....
Reviews.Author: rkn777

Reviews.Content: Thankful that we ignored the online reviews My friends and I were wary about the Kaiserhof Hotel based on the online reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed for three nights during the World Cup suporting our Trinidad and Tobago Soca Warriors, and were very pleased with the location and the service. We arrived from Rome 3am one morning and the staff seemed happy to greet us. The main train station is about 100 metres away, which was EXTREMELY convenient for us travelling to the football matches, we even walked to the Station with our bags when we departed. Yes, the hotel is located between sex shops, and as adults were were quite amused and even invited other Trinidadian friends staying in other parts of Frankfurt to see the red light district. We thoroughly enjoyed Frankfurt from this location, there are many bistro type restaurants nearby and very nice gelato, and across the road there were cyber cafes charging one Euro for one hour. The hotel is clean, the bathroom a good size, and the proximity to the train station and downtown Frankfurt cannot be beat. I would definately stay at the Kaiserhof again
Reviews.Author: sapodillabrown

Reviews.Content: Gross...Creepy Staff I was here about 5 days, and actually left early, gladly paying the extra day anyway. At first, the hotel wasn't so bad, but as time went by, I was hating it. The area is pretty seedy, sex shops to the left and right! It's in a Turkish/Indian district, so it doesn't really 'feel' like I was visiting Germany anyway. The staff was nice, but something about them was a little creepy- the male staff at least. They would be chatty, then just stop and stare. And, the housekeeper was male, and even if i had my 'Do Not Disturb' sign hanging on the door, he'd come in anyway! I hated that, I would try to make sure I was always out for a while at either 8am or noon, even if I wanted to stay in the morning. The room was clean, and the bathroom was nice with a full-sized tub, but clean at the cost of having an overzealous housekeeper and no privacy.Also, the view from my room was ugly- the back of a bunch of old, run-down buildings. Noise carried like crazy there, too. The doors were old and very loud. I could hear the conversations of people in the room next to me clearly, and whenever a door opened, it was so loud it was like someone was coming into my room. And- my window wouldn't close all the way, so every night I could hear people yelling down on the streets, and there were constantly sirens going off- police or ambulance I don't know.I WOULD NOT stay here again. I rode the train in, but there's plenty of other hotels nearby.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Value, close to transport I stayed here twice in August 2005 for a total of 5 nights.3 Nights in a double room (even though I was alone) and the other 2 nights in a single room with a double bed.After arriving at 5:00am in a strange city with a strange language I managed to find my way out of the Frankfurt trainstation and onto the Kaiserstrasse. A short walk across one minor intersection (Moselstrasse) and you are there (100m). Its in a little arcade full of Indian/Asian clothes/fabric stores.If you arrive at a similar time I would recommend sticking to this main street, as a wrong turn at that intersection can lead you up a dodgy street full of sex shops and drunk/drugged people. As I arrived so early I had to go for a walk around Frankfurt to kill a few hours. I would recommend heading up the Kaiserstrasse away from the train station. There is a Starbucks near the Mercedes Dealership about 400m from the hotel. The odd homeless person camping in the Park didn't cause me any trouble.Room wise my first three nights were at the back of the hotel overlooking...nothing interesting. Pretty quiet apart from a group of Canadian and Peruvian youths in Germany for the World Youth Day who were running around the fire escape area. Didn't bother me in the slightest.The other room I stayed in was on the top floor overlooking the main street. Now this had a nice'ish view of the street. But it can get noisy in the early mornings with drunken yelling and brawling. I think the windows are double glazed anyway so just close them and you wont hear a thing. Rooms are air conditioned anyway. Breakfast was good, hard boiled eggs, cold meats, cereal, yoghurt, coffee and oj to name a few.Places to spend some time, around the Stock Exchange is a nice place with some nice shops, also the main shopping district has nice stores. Places to eat, Kaiserstrasse has some nice Kebab shops, gelato shops and and a few Aussie pubs (Kakadu Cafe across from Hotel). Otherwise there is lots of Italian restaraunts like Vapiano on Goetheplatz about 1km from the hotel. Cheap and a very interesting idea for a restaraunt, great pizza and pasta. The whole area around Goetheplatz and Rossmarkt is good, with the main shopping district being on Rossmarkt.I had no problems with the hotel, comfy beds, nice bathrooms, lots of room, clean, fresh towels even if you didn't request them. All I did was sleep there, I didn't really hang around as I was there to see Frankfurt not a hotel room view.
Reviews.Author: Mico_Pulici

Reviews.Content: convenient  Conveniently located, withing walking distance from the Main Railway station (Hauptbahnhof), clean, thoroughly refurbished, helpful staff, really good value for money!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good rate, but some problems... We stood there for three nights in August 2004. The hotel is near the train station, not in the best neighbourhood. The city center (Roemer, Zeil) is just a 10-minute walk.The room was alright, however, the bath was hold, and the ceiling already with some mildew. We had a window to the back, where a huge construction area was. This was the reason that it was terribly loud (noise from the workers, including jack-hammers!). The staff was friendly, but they didn`t really understand both German and English. The price was fine (55 鈧?, however, it was a weekend, and therefore it was much cheaper.If you look for a good rate and do not have high expectations, the Kaiserhof is fine. All in all, I would test another hotel next time.
Reviews.Author: CannibalsFan

Reviews.Content: Not recommended! Not what it looked like in the photos! The hotel is close to the station but in a bad street. Hidden between shops and sex shops! The sheets on the bed all had holes and hair! AT least the breakfast was ok.Not going there again!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: We will come again! We stayed two nights at Kaiserhotel on February, 2004 and we have absolutely nothing to complain! It was perfectly situated, the staff was very friendly and polite, the room was clean and nice; it was cleaned every day, also the towels were changed though we did not demand so! Our opinion is, that if you have something to complain about that hotel, you should look the mirror first.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Bad location, rude staff Stayed here 2 nights, and wouldn't recommend. Some of the staff was nice and helpful but many were rude. It's near the train station (2-minute walk) and saw plenty of street people doing drugs just outside the hotel late at night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Too many problems Dont be fouled by the pictures. This hotel front does not look like the pictures. my experience:I stayed 3 nights and the sheets on the bed were not changed once. Vending machines did not work. View out the window was a service area behind the building. When I wanted to bring a friend up to my room for a hour or so, they told me with additude I would have to pay extra. I will not return to this hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
